page.title: 12A TYPICAL DYKE FARM-MUDHALL
page.content: The origin of Mudhall is Moot Hill which was a meeting place.The size of the farm is 33 hectares.Mudhall is an arable farm,it grows barley, grass, potatoes, turnips, peas.One person works fulltime, 4 part time for potato picking.The barley goes to Moray Firth Maltings, peas for animal feed go to S.A.I., turnips, grass, cattle feed (stay on farm).Seeds go to south dealers the rest go to Ramages in Forres for human consumption.Cattle is kept on the farm, they are bought at Inverness Mart, most come from Thurso area, after they are fat they get killed for butcher meat.Contractors come in to harvest barley, peas, turnips.No contract labour is used for farm related work except draining.The farmer sees farming in the future as smaller farms.
